examples.sentence: A parte restante do bolo foi guardada.
examples.translation: The remaining part of the cake was saved.

examples.sentence: O restante será pago no próximo mês.
examples.translation: The remainder will be paid next month.

examples.sentence: Não sobrou nenhum restante da comida.
examples.translation: There were no leftovers from the food.

etymology.value: From the Latin word 'restans, restantem', the present participle of 'restare' (to remain).

usage_notes.explanation: 'Restante' is used to describe what is left after something has been removed or used. It can function as both an adjective and a noun, depending on the context. As an adjective, it modifies a noun to indicate that it is the remaining part. As a noun, it refers to the remainder or leftovers.

examples.note: When used as an adjective, 'restante' should agree in gender and number with the noun it modifies. In this case, 'pessoas' (people) is feminine plural, so the adjective should be 'restantes'.
While 'restante' can be used as a noun, 'resto' is more common in everyday speech to refer to leftovers or the remainder.

readability_explanation.text: 'Restante' is a word used to describe what is left over or remaining. It can be used as an adjective to modify a noun (e.g., 'o tempo restante' - the remaining time) or as a noun to refer to the remainder (e.g., 'o restante será pago' - the remainder will be paid). It's important to remember to make it agree in gender and number with the noun it modifies when used as an adjective.

example_sentences.sentence: Os alunos restantes devem comparecer à reunião.
example_sentences.translation: The remaining students must attend the meeting.

example_sentences.sentence: O restante do dinheiro será doado.
example_sentences.translation: The remainder of the money will be donated.
